00013 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------

00015 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00016 #ifndef __SIMPLEPTRARRAY_H__
00017 #define __SIMPLEPTRARRAY_H__
00018 
00019 template <class T>
00020 class CMLSimplePtrArray : public CSimpleArray<T>
00021 {
00022       public:
00023       
00024       //Override 
00025       void RemoveAll()
00026       {
00027             if(m_aT != NULL)
00028             {
00029                   for(int i = 0; i < m_nSize; i++)
00030                   {
00031                         delete m_aT[i];
00032                   }
00033                   free(m_aT);
00034                   m_aT = NULL;
00035             }
00036             m_nSize = 0;
00037             m_nAllocSize = 0;
00038       }
00039       BOOL RemoveAt(int nIndex)
00040       {
00041             if (m_aT != NULL)
00042             {
00043                   if(nIndex != (m_nSize - 1))
00044                   {
00045                         delete m_aT[nIndex];
00046                         memmove((void*)&m_aT[nIndex], (void*)&m_aT[nIndex + 1], (m_nSize - (nIndex + 1)) * sizeof(T));
00047                         m_nSize--;
00048                         return TRUE;
00049                   }
00050                   m_nSize--;
00051             }
00052             return FALSE;
00053       }
00054 
00055       //Deletes just the pointer in our array but not the object it points to 
00056       BOOL DetachAt(int nIndex)
00057       {
00058             if (m_aT != NULL)
00059             {
00060                   if(nIndex != (m_nSize - 1))
00061                   {
00062                         memmove((void*)&m_aT[nIndex], (void*)&m_aT[nIndex + 1], (m_nSize - (nIndex + 1)) * sizeof(T));
00063                         m_nSize--;
00064                         return TRUE;
00065                   }
00066                   m_nSize--;
00067             }
00068             return FALSE;
00069       }
00070       
00071       //    Added this method in the VS2008 migration because ATL 7.0 Asserts if you attempt to add
00072       //    an element that already exists in the array. We need to do this in the call to InsertAfter()
00073       BOOL Add_VS6(T& t)
00074       {
00075             if(m_nSize == m_nAllocSize)
00076             {
00077                   T* aT;
00078                   int nNewAllocSize = (m_nAllocSize == 0) ? 1 : (m_nSize * 2);
00079                   aT = (T*)realloc(m_aT, nNewAllocSize * sizeof(T));
00080                   if(aT == NULL)
00081                         return FALSE;
00082                   m_nAllocSize = nNewAllocSize;
00083                   m_aT = aT;
00084             }
00085             m_nSize++;
00086             SetAtIndex(m_nSize - 1, t);
00087             return TRUE;
00088       }
00089 
00090       //To insert at slot 0 call this with -1
00091       void InsertAfter(int iIndex, T& t)
00092       {
00093             if (iIndex < -1)
00094                   return;
00095             if (iIndex >= m_nSize - 1)
00096                   Add(t);
00097             else
00098             {
00099                   //    See description of Add_VS6 above
00100                   Add_VS6(m_aT[m_nSize - 1]);
00101                   
00102                   memmove((void*)&m_aT[iIndex + 2], (void*)&m_aT[iIndex + 1], (m_nSize - (iIndex + 2)) * sizeof(T));
00103                   SetAtIndex(iIndex + 1, t);  //ALASKA was plain iIndex
00104             }
00105             return;
00106       }
00107 };
00108 
00109 #endif // #ifndef __SIMPLEPTRARRAY_H__
